prs.title: OVault - ERC4626Adapter
prs.truncated_body:
This PR introduces the ERC4626Adapter which is compliant with https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-4626

It was created by combining (mostly) OpenZeppelin's ERC4626 [implementation](https://github.com/OpenZeppelin/openzeppelin-contracts/blob/master/contracts/token/ERC20/extensions/ERC4626.sol) and Solmate's [implementation](https://github.com/transmissions11/solmate/blob/main/src/tokens/ERC4626.so

Tasks effected:
Solana wire and solana init config script

Testing:
deploy to solana, create a config like the one below (cannot use simple config), then run the init config cli command, then the wire command and ensure that everything solana side is set as expected.

To test you can base your config off of this one to save time making a config (simple config does not work):
```
import { E

commits.message:
wip
feat: add Aptos SDK components including endpoint, signer, and factory implementations

- Introduced AptosEndpointV2 class implementing IEndpointV2 with placeholder methods.
- Created aptosSdkFactory for generating Aptos OApp instances.
- Implemented aptosSignerFactory for signing transactions specific to Aptos.
- Updated utility functions to integrate Aptos SDK components.
- Enhanced config retrieval to support Aptos network configurations.

refactor: simplify Aptos SDK factory and enhance config retrieval

- Updated createAptosOAppFactory to support multiple chain types and removed unnecessary stub implementations for transaction methods.
- Enhanced config retrieval in config.get.ts to utilize a new subtask for loading configurations, improving clarity and maintainability.
- Ensured type safety by explicitly defining types for unsupported endpoint IDs.

refactor: enhance Aptos SDK factory and wire task for improved transaction handling

- Introduced a createStubTransaction function to streamline transaction stubs in the Aptos SDK factory.
- Updated transaction methods to utilize the new stub function, improving code clarity and maintainability.
- Enhanced the wire task to filter out Aptos and INITIA chain types from graph contracts and connections, optimizing the configuration process.

refactor: integrate Aptos SDK into SDK factory for enhanced multi-chain support

- Added createAptosOAppFactory import to utils.ts.
- Updated createSdkFactory to include aptosSdkFactory, allowing for improved handling of multiple chain types.

refactor: improve SDK factory to handle multiple chain types with error logging

- Updated createSdkFactory to include support for Aptos and improved error handling for unsupported chain types.
- Simplified the return logic for better readability and maintainability.

docs: update README and utils for Solana to Aptos wiring

- Added section in README for one-way wiring from Solana to Aptos, including configuration requirements and resources.
- Updated utils.ts to use OAppOmniGraph instead of OAppOmniGraphHardhat, and adjusted loading configuration logic for improved clarity and functionality.

docs: restructure Solana to Aptos wiring instructions

- Moved detailed wiring instructions from README.md to a new Aptos.md file for better organization.
- Updated README.md to reference the new documentation location, simplifying the content and improving clarity.
putting aptos specific stubs in their own folder

refactor: clean up comments in createSdkFactory function

- Removed unnecessary comments in utils.ts to enhance code readability and maintainability.

refactor: remove redundant comments in createSdkFactory function

- Eliminated unnecessary comments in the createSdkFactory function to streamline the code and enhance readability.
docs: update Aptos wiring documentation to reflect Move-VM terminology and clarify one-way pathways

prs.title: DEVREL-513 feat: update oapp for docs rewrite
prs.truncated_body:
Update the OApp example so that:

1. Enforced options actually works. At some point our lz:oapp:wire package changed so that it REQUIRES enforced options in any contract using the CLI, otherwise the wiring reverts.
2. Adds better comments and descriptions for how to modify this example contract.
3. Adds a simple task to call sendString after deployment.

Proof of work: https://layerzeroscan.

prs.title: cli: Add commands to create valid SPL Multisig and set mint authority
prs.truncated_body:
This PR adds:
* Add `create_spl_multisig <multisigMemberPubkey...>` command that mimics `spl-token create-multisig` to create valid SPL Multisig.
* Add `set-mint-authority <newAuthority>` command that sets mint authority based on version:
  * If version < `3.x.x`: calls `spl.setAuthority` directly
  * If version >= `3.x.x`: calls `acceptTokenAuthority`
  * Also handles cases where `newAuthori

commits.message: Run formatter and update GitHub link
Factor out function to get chain context
Add `create-spl-multisig` command to create valid SPL multisig
Add `set-mint-authority` command to set token mint authority to `token-authority` PDA (or valid SPL Multisig)

Add `console.error` to run 'ntt upgrade' for lower manager versions

Co-authored-by: evgeniko <97796468+evgeniko@users.noreply.github.com>
Add link to valid SPL Multisig docs
Use `ntt solana set-mint-authority` instead of `spl-token authorize`
Direct to demo repo if current mint authority is `tokenAuthority` PDA or valid SPL Multisig

prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

This PR is modifying the reorg detection logic within the sequence window expiry acceptance test, so that it tolerates a "not found" error.

It is also adding tolerance for empty `ParentHash` check within the reorg detection logic.

---

`TestSequencingWindowExpiry`, the single test in the `seqwindow` package, passed with `-count=20`.

prs.title: Refactor logging framework to declarative filtering system
prs.truncated_body:
The logfilter package implements a generic log filtering framework for the Optimism codebase that provides declarative filtering capabilities with tri-state logic support.

### Key Features:

**Tri-State Logic System:**
- Uses `tri.Tri` (True, False, Unknown) instead of simple booleans for more nuanced filtering decisions
- Allows for sophisticated filter composition where undefined states c

After veblop, a previously imported/produced block could become invalid, due to dynamic span rotation. This PR will automatically detect when this happens and rewind invalid blocks.

---------

Co-authored-by: Sina Mahmoodi <itz.s1na@gmail.com>
trie: revert back lock before reset
fix nil pointer dereference on DoCall

Merge pull request #31228 from curvegrid/fix-sim-rollback

Merge pull request #1506 from maticnetwork/mardizzone/nil-check

core/txpool/legacypool: fix data race in checkDelegationLimit (#31475)
internal/ethapi: add max gas in gaspool while executing eth_call

core/txpool: fix nonce assignment in local tracker (#31496)

Fixes #31494

core/filtermaps: revert to unindexed mode in case of indexing error (#31500)

This PR changes log indexer error handling so that if an indexing error
happens then it disables the indexer and reverts to unindexed more
without resetting the database (except in case of a failed database
init).
Resetting the database on the first error would probably be overkill as
a client update might fix this without having to reindex the entire
history. It would also make debugging very hard. On the other hand,
these errors do not resolve themselves automatically so constantly
retrying makes no sense either. With these changes a new attempt to
resume indexing is made every time the client is restarted.
The PR also fixes https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/31491
which originated from the tail indexer trying to resume processing a
failed map renderer.

---------

Co-authored-by: Felix Lange <fjl@twurst.com>
core: emit sidechain event during reorg

.gitignore: ignore binaries (#31531)

Ignores all hand-built binaries (built with go build, everything built
with make is already ignored)

core/filtermaps: hashdb safe delete range (#31525)

This PR adds `rawdb.SafeDeleteRange` and uses it for range deletion in
`core/filtermaps`. This includes deleting the old bloombits database,
resetting the log index database and removing index data for unindexed
tail epochs (which previously weren't properly implemented for the
fallback case).
`SafeDeleteRange` either calls `ethdb.DeleteRange` if the node uses the
new path based state scheme or uses an iterator based fallback method
that safely skips trie nodes in the range if the old hash based state
scheme is used. Note that `ethdb.DeleteRange` also has its own iterator
based fallback implementation in `ethdb/leveldb`. If a path based state
scheme is used and the backing db is pebble (as it is on the majority of
new nodes) then `rawdb.SafeDeleteRange` uses the fast native range
delete.
Also note that `rawdb.SafeDeleteRange` has different semantics from
`ethdb.DeleteRange`, it does not automatically return if the operation
takes a long time. Instead it receives a `stopCallback` that can
interrupt the process if necessary. This is because in the safe mode
potentially a lot of entries are iterated without being deleted (this is
definitely the case when deleting the old bloombits database which has a
single byte prefix) and therefore restarting the process every time a
fixed number of entries have been iterated would result in a quadratic
run time in the number of skipped entries.

When running in safe mode, unindexing an epoch takes about a second,
removing bloombits takes around 10s while resetting a full log index
might take a few minutes. If a range delete operation takes a
significant amount of time then log messages are printed. Also, any
range delete operation can be interrupted by shutdown (tail uinindexing
can also be interrupted by head indexing, similarly to how tail indexing
works). If the last unindexed epoch might have "dirty" index data left
then the indexed map range points to the first valid epoch and
`cleanedEpochsBefore` points to the previous, potentially dirty one. At
startup it is always assumed that the epoch before the first fully
indexed one might be dirty. New tail maps are never rendered and also no
further maps are unindexed before the previous unindexing is properly
cleaned up.

---------

Co-authored-by: Gary Rong <garyrong0905@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Felix Lange <fjl@twurst.com>

Some compilers will subsequently wrap around and overwrite a stack variable, which either segfaults the process or worse. I observed it overwriting the `topo` stack

# Description

Resolves #4696

This change special cases level 0 Bucket merges to happen all in-memory, without file IO. To accomplish this, all level 0 buckets retain an in-memory vector of their contents. prs.title: Deduplicate partial and full GMessage validation logic
prs.truncated_body:
Prior to launch the partial message validation logic was copied from the core of GPBFT to work within the activation timescale leaving a technical debt behind. The work pays back that debt by unifying the two validation logics into one. It:

* alters the core GPBFT validation logic to understand the notion of partial messages.
* changes the basic validation logic to worth with and without parti

commits.message:
Deduplicate partial and full GMessage validation logic

Prior to launch the partial message validation logic was copied from the
core of GPBFT to work within the activation timescale leaving a
technical debt behind. The work pays back that debt by unifying the two
validation logics into one. It:

* alters the core GPBFT validation logic to understand the notion of
  partial messages.
* changes the basic validation logic to worth with and without partial
  information.
* moves GPBFT basic types into their own Go file to reduce clutter in
  the core GPBFT implementation
* enhances tests to exercise both partial+full and full message
 validation in tests.

Fixes #826
Update docs on GMessage to clarify signature paylaod signing
Incorporate the entire message in computing cache key for messages

prs.title: Add support for XSVM grpc server reflection
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

Allows clients to discover the service definition + request/response types without knowing the proto file

## How this works

Registers the xsvm grpc server into the grpc reflection api. Clients who don't know the proto file (postman, grpcurl) can query the reflection api to discover the available grpc services + its types to be able to communicate with the serv

commits.message:
add support for server reflection

prs.title: state_traceBlock: replay the block with proof recording
prs.truncated_body:
The RPC method `state_traceBlock` replays the block without proof recording, that introduce a mismatch in the storage root (and the intermediate storage root in the Frontier digest item).

This PR update our polkadot SDK fork to include https://github.com/moonbeam-foundation/polkadot-sdk/pull/20 and add a test to make sure that `state_traceBlock` succeed.

prs.title: build: rename test-clients/src/main/resources/log4j2-test.xml
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

The file in `test-clients/src/main/resources/log4j2.xml` is a test resource that should take precedence over a production code resource with the same name (`platform-sdk/swirlds-platform-core/src/main/resources/log4j2.xml`). This worked as the ordering on the classpath was by chance working in our favor. With #19059, the order in which resources are discovered changed.

This

prs.title: chore: yaci-store upgrade to 0.1.3 to fix downstream issue that showed up only on preview environment.
prs.truncated_body:
Fixes issue with yaci / ccl / yaci-store related to preview network and blockchain data parsing exception:

```
2025-06-10T14:25:39.670+02:00 ERROR 1241004 --- [Yaci Store App] [nioEventLoopGroup-4-1] c.b.c.y.c.p.blockfetch.BlockfetchAgent   : Error in parsing

com.bloxbean.cardano.client.exception.CborRuntimeException: Error parsing native script
        at com.bloxbean.cardano.yaci.core.mo

commits.message: chore: yaci-store upgrade to 0.1.3 to fix downstream issue that showed up only on preview environment.
